top_categories.workout_context: Filthy 50’s minnesota gravel roads (80%), dirt roads (20%) demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Filthy 50 isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Filthy 50 rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Filthy 50’s minnesota rolling gravel—fall colors and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Filthy 50 when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Filthy 50. Make this intensity feel like home.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Filthy 50 — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Filthy 50’s minnesota rolling gravel—fall colors drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Filthy 50 — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on minnesota rolling gravel—fall colors.
The varied gradients at Filthy 50 reward climbing adaptability — knowing when to sit, when to stand, and when to switch.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Filthy 50 — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Filthy 50’s minnesota rolling gravel—fall colors delivers on race day.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Filthy 50’s 50 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Filthy 50 requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on minnesota rolling gravel—fall colors to build confidence. Expect: minnesota gravel roads (80%), dirt roads (20%), rolling terrain.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and TT Threshold to prepare you for 50 miles of minnesota rolling gravel—fall colors in Northern Minnesota (route varies).
